Sure thing! Here are some tips for making crispy kale chips:

1. Dry the kale completely: Wash the kale leaves and dry them thoroughly with a paper towel or a salad spinner. Excess water on the kale leaves will make the chips soggy.

2. Remove the thick stems: The stems of the kale leaves are tough and can hinder the chips from getting crispy. Remove and discard the stems before baking.

3. Don't overcrowd the baking sheet: Spread the kale leaves evenly on a baking sheet and make sure that they are not overlapping. Overcrowding can prevent the chips from getting crispy.

4. Use a high temperature: Set the oven to 350°F/180°C or higher. A high temperature will help the kale chips to get crispy.

5. Use a light coating of oil: Drizzle a teaspoon or two of olive oil over the kale leaves and toss them lightly to make sure the leaves are coated evenly. Too much oil can make the chips greasy.

6. Season lightly: Sprinkle a pinch of salt or your favorite seasoning over the kale leaves. Don't over-season, as too much salt can also make the chips soggy.

7. Check frequently: Kale chips can burn quickly, so keep an eye on them while baking.

Hope these tips help you make crispy kale chips!
